intro: Micropholis portoricensis var. mesuifolia, commonly known as the Puerto Rican mahogany, is a small evergreen tree native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mountain forests and is often found in limestone soils. Its fruits are small drupes that contain a single seed, and it plays an important ecological role in its native ecosystem.
